Description: Conical jar of rough straw-tempered Nile silt pottery with rounded point base and rolled rim. Incised post-firing on one side with Z-shaped potmark. Below the rim on the other side is a horizontal mark made before firing by the potter’s finger.
Curator's comments: Rough ware R81 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Marked B on side.
